p: Alkaloids are a group of important secondary metabolites. Alkaloids and extracts of alkaloid-containing plants have been used throughout human history as remedies, poisons, and psychoactive drugs. Stachydrine has been identified in many Lamiaceae species [ 53, 54]. Multiple studies have confirmed that stachydrine has strong neuroprotective, anti-fibrotic, and anti-inflammatory effects [ 70]. Stachydrine ( 127) was reported in L. inebrians and L. hirsutissimus [ 42, 54, 63]. 3-Methyl-1,2,3,4-tetrahydroquinoline ( 128), 4-hydroxyisoquinoline ( 129), songoramine ( 130), and songorine ( 131) were determined from L. ilicifolius [ 21] ( Table 3, Figure S7).
